Maybe installing libvorbis-dev (or something similar) would help
I installed the Nemo codec pack in WINE and copied all of the files it installed to /usr/lib/codecs and now MPlayer can play pretty much anything

If you want to do the Nemo thing I said then you may want to change the owner and group of the files in the fake windows directory that WINE creates, then you can use ls -l | grep yourusername to find out which files Nemo installed
Enabling root is pretty easy, but it shouldn't be done

Sudo lets normal users run programs as super user. If you log in as root then you can easily destroy your system (even if you don't mean to, any hacker or virus [however improbable]  would have root access)
then how do i disable it?
then how do i disable it?
If you have root enabled then log in as root in a terminal and use "passwd -l"
